brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to investigate the metabolic effects during acute inflammation
      with and without the nutritional supplement of amino acids.

      E. Coli Endotoxin (LPS, lipopolysaccharide) is used to initiate an inflammatory response.

      The study is an interventional randomized placebo study including 8 healthy male subjects.
      Each subject participates 3 times (different days) and are given one of following
      interventions:

        -  Placebo (NaCl)

        -  Endotoxin, US standard reference E.Coli + Placebo (NaCl)

        -  Endotoxin, US standard reference E.Coli + Amino acids (intravenously)

      It is our hypothesis that the nutritional intervention during acute inflammation plays an
      important role in lipid and protein metabolism.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Amino Acid Supplement During Acute Inflammation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  male gender

          -  20<BMI<30

          -  Age > 25 years old

          -  Written consent before starting the study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Allergy for soya products ore egg

          -  Diabetes

          -  Epilepsy

          -  Infection

          -  Immune defects

          -  Heart disease

          -  Dysregulated hypertension

          -  Participating in other trials using radioactive tracers or x-rays the last year.

facility.name: Medical Department MEA, NBG, Aarhus University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Metabolic Effects of Endotoxin Induced Acute Inflammation in Healthy Young Men With and Without Supplement of Amino Acids.

primary_outcome.description: Protein catabolism is measured with amino acid tracer techniques comparing radioactive marked amino acids from blood samples.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: A muscle + fat biopsy are taken twice during the intervention to focus on the local effects in these tissues.
secondary_outcome.measure: The local effects on muscle and fat tissue

secondary_outcome.description: Lipid and glucose metabolism are measured with tracer techniques with radioactive marked glucose + lipid.
secondary_outcome.measure: Other systemic metabolic effects during acute illness

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
